answers.answer: Metformin is used to treat high blood sugar, and it can cause low blood sugar especially if not enough food was eaten.  Yes unless I missed something I would say something is goofed.  What was his blood sugar normally?

Wow, im on 1000mg of Metformin Twice a day.   Because my blood sugar is usually in 300-400 or even higher if i dont take it or even just overeat carbs.  I would love to have those numbers.. i have to workout like crazy and eat very little to get close to those and thats also with taking another med with the metformin. I would say something is very wrong with what they are trying to do.
Tiffany, do you still taking Januvia?
yes im still taking januvia..  almost ran out other day :(  had to rush to pharmacy and get it on Friday,  I did a test, i didnt take it right away in morning and my number went up to 324mg/dL.

I would be sure to get a second opinion. Run as fast as you can from this doctor and go find another one. If you live near a major teaching hospital (College University that has a medical school) go there. This is where doctors get trained and learn all the new medicine after they get licensed to "practice". Here is where you will find the experts.If your sons last two numbers were accurate he's hypoglycemic, and does NOT require Metformin, especially at the doses you mentioned. To say your son needs to go up to 1000 mg daily is borderline insanity.Here's why I say that. My monthly fasting glucose averages 122-129 mg/dl. And my HbA1c is 6%, sometimes at 5.9%. My Metformin dose was 250 mg ONCE daily. I increased that to 500 mg once daily in order to eat fruit. That's it!Make an appointment with a nutrionist too to see why your son has an eating disorder.

question: My son is 24 years old and just had a 3 hour fasting glucose tolerance test.  His fasting blood was 88, his next count after drinking the sugary liquid was 102, his next two were 69 and 61.  It seems like he has hypoglycemia.  He was told he has pre-diabetes and given a prescription for metformin 500 mg to take once a day for a week and to increase by a pill a day/week until he would be taking 4 pills/day within a month.  Everything I have read says that this is given for high blood sugar.  He is also very underweight.  I am very confused as to the purpose of this medication.
title: Hypoglycemia and metformin
